title: Yasuo could be gutted and people would still ban him for two reasons
body:
1 They still don't know how to play against him.
2 They don't want people playing Yasuo on their team.

it is a game about having fun by working with allies, but it is a competition, so, the player makes decisions that they think will help their team win unless they are not playing the game within its actual context and are instead playing with friends.  Such decisions include removing champions that are themselves nuisances to gameplay, banning champions that are or can be overpowered, working with the group and educating (if possible) those uninformed of detrimental flaws within their logic or reasoning.

Banning pick intent can be avoided, but to make progress, people have to work with one another, not against one another except for the adversity competition brings to innovation.

for the sake of your line of reasoning, I will attempt to explain the OP's tenacity and self-explanatory line of thought.

"Yasuo is unfun to play against" , conditionally, fun allows the player to focus on the game and the objectives, not instead on attempting to make the unfun experience "go away" as yasuo is often a high-priority target simply by his versatility and impact on the flow of the game.

Will you acknowledge that yasuo is: A high damage carry, A split-pusher, a high-mobility and crowd control capable champion, resource-less in lane, capable of nullifying an opposing team's strategy at one key moment, a champion capable of suppressing enemies for almost 2 seconds?

Despite that league is a competition, for all intents and purposes other than making money, league of legends is intended to be a fun, competitive environment. Though yasuo is fun for the player playing him, he is often unfun for the players he is playing against and his own team and carries too much weight for the decision-making processes of league(such as having to change how champions behave and interact in lane just to avoid how the champion functions)

I personally would not ban him, but that is because in my intended lane and the game in general, there are typically better champions to ban, but if I were a midlaner or a champion reliant on skill-shots, I might ban yasuo simply to remove a threat to reliable strategy.

Yasuo is a highly contested source of debate for his design flaws and Riot is well aware of his issues, but to change any part of him breaks gameplay revolving around him and he is thus left alone until a solution can be found that is practical and enjoyable for all players
